question_text: A multimeter reading shows 11.1V on a 12V rail from the power supply. What should a technician conclude?
answer_options: This is normal and within tolerance
The power supply must be replaced immediately
The voltage is too high and will damage components
correct_answer: This is normal and within tolerance
explanation: Most systems tolerate Â±5% voltage variation, meaning 11.4V to 12.6V is acceptable for a 12V rail.
